result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Joseph Ross

records.addlTxt: Status conference on February 13, 2023 at 03:00 pm.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains in effect.

3:011 PM Defendant Daniel Joseph Ross appeared by video .  Attorney George Steve Pappas Jr. appeared by video for Daniel Joseph Ross.  Attorney Aleksandra Hodowany.in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at. Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.
Status conference scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 03:00 pm.

11:18 AM Defendant Daniel Joseph Ross appeared by video.  Attorney George Steve Pappas Jr. appeared by phone for Daniel Joseph Ross.   Attorney Aleksandra Hodowany in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Pappas indicates an offer has been received, needs time to go over with defendant, requests another date.. bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on October 17, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Documents from 8/23/22 returned mail remailed to defendant at new address.

9:32 AM  Defendant Daniel Joseph Ross appeared by video.  Attorney George Steve Pappas Jr. appeared by video for Daniel Joseph Ross.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Pappas accepts court appointment.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limits for prelim, requests a status be set.  State has no objection.   Atty Pappas requests zoom appearance for himself and defendant for next hearing.  Court grants request. Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 11:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel Joseph Ross
Current: 906 Parnell Street, Marinette, WI 54143   (Effective: 08-02-2022)
Prior: 900 Wells St, Marinette, WI 54143
Defendant advised by phone of Atty Pappas being appointed and change of court date.  Hearing notice and payment plan schedule going out in todays mail for defendant.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Per email from Atty George Pappas, he will take court appointment but is not available for 8/29/22 AIA.  JA Parks will contact Atty Pappas to reschedule hearing.
Contract for Repayment of Court-appointed Attorney Fees

12:12 PM  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel Joseph Ross in court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defendant indicates he doesn't qualify for SPD representation, requests court appointed counsel.   Court will have the clerk contact Atty George Pappas or Atty Randall Petrouske to see if one of them will take a court appointment.  Court sets repayment of atty fees at $100 per month with first payment due by 8/31/22.  Court approves zoom appearance for defendant at next hearing.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

1:00 PM  Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel Joseph Ross appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Defendant doesn't qualify for SPD, requests form for court appointed attorney.  (petition for court appointed attorney form sent to defendant at the jail with his bond)  Return 8/08/22 at 10:00 am.
